initializeFailed.title: Setup Failed
initializeFailed.message: OpenGraphica relies on some basic web functionality that does not exist in your browser. Please update your web browser, or switch to a modern one like Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge.

updateRequired.title: Update Required
updateRequired.message: The editor tried to fetch a file that is no longer available. Please refresh the page to continue. Clear your browser's cache if you keep seeing this message. Use the "Restore Last Image" option in the menu to continue where you left off.

modeOptionDescription.luminance: = (0.22 × R) + (0.72 × G) + (0.06 × B) as linearized RGB
modeOptionDescription.luma: = (0.22 × R) + (0.72 × G) + (0.06 × B) as non-linearized RGB

tools.blur: Blur specific areas of the image

tools.effect: Manipulate layer colors and add filter effects

tools.brush: Erase areas of the image with brush strokes

tools.selection: Select specifc areas of the image to edit, cut, copy, or delete

tools.freeTransform: Move, scale, rotate layers, and manage layer boundaries

tools.zoom: Zoom in and out, pan, or rotate your view of the image

fontNotify.title: Loading Fonts
fontNotify.pleaseWait: Please wait, these fonts are being loaded:

fileExport.title: Export Image
fileExport.saveBackIntroduction: You have opened a file named {fileName}.
fileExport.saveBackQuestion: Save back to the original file?

fileOpenConfirm.title: Are you sure?
warning: You have made edits to your current file. If you open a new file now, these edits will be discarded. If you only wish to add new layers to this file, use the {insertPhoto} option.
Do you wish to continue to open a new file and discard all of your changes?

fileSaveAs.title: Save Image As
fileSaveAs.saveBackIntroduction: You have opened a file named {fileName}.
fileSaveAs.saveBackQuestion: Save back to the original file?
fileSaveAs.exportDisclaimer: If you wish to share or view the image in other programs, use "Export" instead.

noCameraError.title: Camera Unavailable
noCameraError.message: Either the device has no cameras or access to the camera was declined.

normal.description: The top layer covers the bottom based on its opacity.
normal.example: Cutting out a person from one photo and adding them to another photo.

dissolve.description: Randomly replaces pixels from the top layer with transparent pixels based on opacity, creating a digital noise effect.

colorErase.description: Removes the color from the top layer that matches the color of the lower layer.
colorErase.example: Removing a green screen background from an image.

erase.description: Erases the bottom layer where the top layer is opaque.
erase.example: Removing unwanted objects in a photo by erasing those areas.

lightenOnly.description: Keeps the lighter color in each R,G,B channel of the top and bottom layers.
lightenOnly.example: Adding a glow effect to an object without darkening the surrounding areas.

lumaLightenOnly.description: Compares the perceptual brightness between the top and bottom layers and keeps the brighter pixels.
lumaLightenOnly.example: Enhancing the brightness of a specific area in a black and white photo.

screen.description: Lightens the bottom layer based on the brightness of the top layer. Screen mimics the way light interacts when projected or layered.
screen.example: Making a night scene appear brighter.

dodge.description: Significantly brightens highlights and brings out details in the shadows. This mimics the effect of "dodging" in darkroom photography.

linearDodge.description: Adds the brightness of the top and bottom layers in perceptual SRGB space.

addition.description: Adds the brightness of the top and bottom layers in linear SRGB space.

darkenOnly.description: Keeps the darker color in each R,G,B channel of the top and bottom layers.
darkenOnly.example: Darkening the shadows in a photo.

lumaDarkenOnly.description: Compares the perceptual darkness between the top and bottom layers and keeps the darker pixels.

multiply.description: Darkens the bottom layer based on the darkness of the top layer. Multiply mimics how multiple photographic negatives look when layered together.
multiply.example: Making an image look darker, like simulating shadows or night scenes.

burn.description: Darkens the bottom layer proportional to the darkness of the top layer.

linearBurn.description: Adds the pixels of the upper and lower layers, then subtracts the brightest possible value.
linearBurn.example: Adding a dramatic shadowy look to the image.

overlay.description: A combination of multiply and screen, where light areas become lighter and dark areas become darker.
overlay.example: Adding contrast to photos without losing detail.

softLight.description: Brightens the image similar to overlay but with more gradual transitions. Soft light simulates diffused lighting.
softLight.example: Adding a soft glow to portraits.

hardLight.description: A harsher version of overlay, where bright areas become much brighter and dark areas much darker.
hardLight.example: Dramatically increasing the contrast in action scenes.

vividLight.description: Increases the contrast very strongly, even more compared to hard light.
vividLight.example: Stylizing photos with bold, punchy colors and contrast.

pinLight.description: Replaces pixels based on brightness, keeping the brightest and darkest pixels, based on their distance from midtones.
pinLight.example: Creating a posterized effect with sharp contrast between light and dark.

linearLight.description: Increases contrast linearly, brightening or darkening based on the top layer.
linearLight.example: Simulating artificial lighting or enhancing metallic surfaces.

hardMix.description: Reduces the image to primary colors, creating a highly stylized look.
hardMix.example: Creating a comic book or screen-printed effect.

difference.description: Finds the difference between layers, where black is no difference increasing color brightness is more different.
difference.example: Aligning layers with similar content. When two pixels are the same, they turn black.

exclusion.description: A variation of difference with less contrast, for where subtle differences need to be highlighted without overwhelming the image.

subtract.description: Subtracts the brightness in the top layer from the bottom. The result is a lot of black or near-black areas.

grainExtract.description: Extracts the film grain from a layer, also gives an embossed appearance.
grainExtract.example: Extracting grain from a film texture to apply to another texture.

grainMerge.description: Adds grain from the top layer to the bottom, leaving a grainy version of the original layer.
grainMerge.example: Adding film grain to a digital image for a vintage look.

divide.description: Divides the brightness of the top layer by the bottom.
divide.example: Lightening an image dramatically, creating a glowing or ethereal effect. Can be used for exposure correction.

hue.description: Uses the hue of the top layer while preserving the chroma and lightness of the bottom layer.
hue.example: Changing a blue sky to purple while retaining its brightness.

chroma.description: Uses the chroma (intensity of color) of the top layer while preserving the hue and lightness of the bottom layer.
chroma.example: Boosting or reducing the intensity of colors in a photo.

color.description: Combines the hue and chroma of the top layer with the lightness of the bottom layer.
color.example: Recoloring an object while keeping the shading and lighting intact.

lightness.description: Uses the lightness of the top layer while preserving the hue and chroma of the bottom layer.
lightness.example: Lightening or darkening an image while keeping the colors true.

luminance.description: Divides upper layer luminance by lower layer, then multiplies the result to the lower layer.
luminance.example: Lightening or darkening an image while keeping the colors true.

layerEffectBrowser.title: Effect Browser
layerEffectBrowser.description: Choose an effect to add to the layer. Effects generally manipulate the colors of a layer or add special patterns like blurring effects.
layerEffectBrowser.generationErrorGeneral: An error occurred when generating effect previews for the selected layer.
layerEffectBrowser.generationErrorUnsupportedType: The layer you have selected is unable to have filters applied to it.
layerEffectBrowser.generationErrorNoLayer: Please select one or more layers in the layers dock in order to add effects to them.

layerEffectEdit.title: Edit Effect
layerEffectEdit.description: Edit the effect for a specific layer.
layerEffectEdit.generalError: Something went wrong. If you keep seeing this message, please report this as a bug.
layerEffectEdit.deleteFilterError: An error occurred while attempting to delete the filter. If you keep seeing this message, please report this as a bug.
layerEffectEdit.applyFilterError: An error occurred while attempting to apply the filter changes. If you keep seeing this message, please report this as a bug.

file.name: File Management
file.description: Load and save images to your device.

export.name: Export Image
export.description: Save the image in a universal format that can be opened by other editors.

insertPhoto.name: Insert a Photo
insertPhoto.description: Add a photo as a new layer in the currently opened image.

new.name: New Image
new.description: Create a new image with specified dimensions.

open.name: Open Image
open.description: Open an image or project file in a new workspace.

quickLoad.name: Quick Load
quickLoad.description: Load the file saved by quick save.

quickSave.name: Quick Save
quickSave.description: Saves the current file to temporary storage.

restoreBackup.name: Restore Backup Image
restoreBackup.description: Load the backup file saved automatically during editing.

saveAs.name: Save Image As
saveAs.description: Saves the image in a project format that can be re-opened by OpenGraphica without losing any information.

takePhoto.name: Take a Photo
takePhoto.description: Take a photo from your camera and webcam and insert it into the image.

history.name: Editing History
history.description: Operations that control moving through the history of image edits.

image.name: Image Canvas
image.description: Operations that affect the image canvas.

convertLayersToCollage.name: Convert Layers to Collage
convertLayersToCollage.description: Converts the selected layers to an image collage. There are many different collage layouts available.

convertLayersToImageSequence.name: Convert Layers to Image Sequence
convertLayersToImageSequence.description: Converts the selected layers to an image sequence layer (animation).

convertLayersFlatten.name: Convert Layers to Flattened Image
convertLayersFlatten.description: Merges all layers to a single image layer and adds it to the top of the layer stack.

copy.name: Copy Selected Layers
copy.description: Copy the currently selected layers to the clipboard.

noSelectedLayers.title: No Layers Selected
noSelectedLayers.message: Please select at least one layer to copy.

copyAll.name: Copy All Layers
copyAll.description: Copy all layers on the canvas as a PNG image to the clipboard.

cut.name: Cut
cut.description: Remove the currently selected layers and copy them to the clipboard.

paste.name: Paste
paste.description: Insert images on to the canvas from the clipboard.

rename.name: Rename Layer
rename.description: Change the name of a layer.

blendingMode.name: Change Layer Blending Mode
blendingMode.description: Change the blending mode of the active layer.

layerEffectBrowser.name: Effect Browser
layerEffectBrowser.description: Adds image effects to the currently selected layer(s) or layer group(s).

tmp.name: Temporary Modules
tmp.description: Modules that will only stick around during initial development.

noBrushesInCategory.title: No Brushes
noBrushesInCategory.message: This category has no brushes. Create some!

blending.title: Blending
blending.densityDescription: How transparent each stamp of the brush will be, based on pen pressure. The range is used when varying pen pressure.
blending.colorBlendingStrengthDescription: How much of the color underneath the brush will be picked up while drawing. The range is used when varying pen pressure.
blending.colorBlendingPersistenceDescription: How long the picked up color remains on the brush while dragging the stroke.
blending.concentrationDescription: Lower values simulate brush dilution with water, and high values full concentrated color. This setting has no effect when drawing on top of fully opaque colors. The range is used when varying pen pressure.

shape.title: Shape
shape.hardnessDescription: Lower values will have soft faded edges, and higher values sharp edges.

strokePath.title: Stroke Path
strokePath.spacingDescription: The distance between each stamp of the brush, relative to the brush size. Be careful with extremely low values, as it can tank performance on larger brush sizes.
strokePath.jitterDescription: Randomly shifts the position of the brush shape.

pressure.title: Pressure
pressure.pressureTaperDescription: Higher values will draw skinnier lines at lower pen pressures. Makes it easier to control pens with unstable sensitivity at lower pressures.
pressure.pressureMinSizeDescription: The size of the brush at 0% pen pressure, relative to the currently selected brush size.

edit.noLayersSelected: Please select one or more layers in the layers dock in order to edit their effects.

noSelectedLayers.title: No Layers Selected
noSelectedLayers.message: Please select at least one image layer in the layers dock. Certain layer types can't be erased.

unproductiveSelection.title: No Layers Selected
unproductiveSelection.message:
You have created a selection mask on top of the image.

Please select at least one image layer in the layers dock.

text.fillTooltip: Color that shows inside the edges of the letter(s)

deform.name: Deform
deform.description: Tools that manipulate the existing image data, such as cloning, bulging, blurring.

blur.name: Blur
blur.description: Brush that blurs the area drawn.

draw.name: Draw
draw.description: Brushes, pencils, pens, and vector art drawing tools.

brush.name: Brush
brush.description: Draw on layers as if you are using a paint brush.

effect.name: Effect
effect.description: Adjust layer colors, add blurring and other effects.

cropResize.name: Crop and Resize
cropResize.description: Crop, resize, change aspect ratio, or resample the image.

selection.name: Selection
selection.description: Select areas of the active layer(s), any manipulations to the layer(s) only occur inside the selection.

selection.name: Selection
selection.description: Select an area of the image for targeted editing.

transform.name: Transform
transform.description: Tools for moving, rotating, scaling the layer.

freeTransform.name: Free Transform
freeTransform.description: Move, rotate, or scale the selected layers.

view.name: Viewport Display
view.description: Tools for controlling the viewport display of the canvas.

tools.name: Zoom
tools.description: Zoom in and out the canvas to control how much of the image you can see.

deformBlurToolIntroduction.title: Blur Tool
introduction: The blur tool will blur the portion of current layer you draw on.

drawToolIntroduction.title: Draw Tool
introduction: The draw tool lets you create lines and shapes.

drawGradientToolIntroduction.title: Gradient Tool
introduction: The gradient tool lets you add gradient layers. You can control the visible bounds of this tool by combining it with the selection tool or the erase tool.

mouse: Click and drag to place a gradient on the canvas.
touch: Use one finger to touch and drag to place a gradient on the canvas.

drawShapeToolIntroduction.title: Shape Tool
introduction: The shape tool lets you add various basic shapes, which can be converted into vector paths if more customization is needed.

mouse: Click and drag to place a shape on the canvas.
touch: Use one finger to touch and drag to place a shape on the canvas.

effectToolIntroduction.title: Effect Tool
introduction: The effect tool allows to add layer effects that can adjust colors and do all sorts of other useful operations to the entire layer. Effects can be stacked and removed at any time.

eraseToolIntroduction.title: Erase Tool
introduction: The erase tool allows you to remove parts of the layer, making them transparent.

explainCanvasViewportControls.title: Moving the Canvas
introduction: No matter which tool is selected, you can control the canvas view.

mouse: {zooming} - Use the {mouseWheel} to zoom in and out.
{panning} - Click and drag with the {rightMouseButton} to move the canvas.
touch: {zooming} - Use two fingers and pinch to zoom in and out.
{panning} - Use two fingers and slide them together to move the canvas.

freeTransformToolIntroduction.title: Free Transform Tool
introduction: This tool moves, resizes, and rotates layers. A boundary box shows around the selected layer(s).

mouse: {selection} - {leftClick} on a layer to select it.
{moving} - {leftClick} on a layer and drag to move it.
touch: {selection} - Tap on a layer to select it.
{moving} - Tap on a layer and drag to move it.
{resizing} - Use one finger to drag resize handles.

selectionToolIntroduction.title: Selection Tool
introduction: The selection tool allows you to select specific parts of the image to restrict what editing affects.

mouse: {createSelection} - Click and drag with {leftClick} to create a selection.
touch: {createSelection} - Draw with one finger to create a selection.
end: {selectionShape} - What shape is used to draw the selection.
{selectionCombineMode} - How the current selection combines with the existing selection.

zoomToolIntroduction.title: Zoom/Pan Tool
introduction: This tool lets you zoom in to the image, and move the view around.

mouse: {zooming} - {leftClick} to zoom in; {ctrlLeftClick} to zoom out.
{panning} - Click and drag with the {leftMouseButton} to move the canvas.
touch: {zooming} - Tap with one finger to zoom in. Tap with two fingers to zoom out.
{panning} - Tap and drag with one finger to move the canvas.
